decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with low-cost creatures and disruptive spells. It utilizes cards like Spyglass Siren and Floodpits Drowner to control the board, while also using cards like Enduring Curiosity and Faebloom Trick to generate card advantage and maintain pressure. With a mix of evasion, removal, and card draw, this Dimir Aggro deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent, culminating in a relentless assault that leaves them with few options to counter.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells, utilizing cards like Fear of Missing Out, Yuna, Hope of Spira, and Overlord of the Boilerbilges. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to colored mana sources. Support cards like Dredger's Insight and Torch the Tower provide card advantage and removal, while powerful finishers like Bahamut and Joshua, Phoenix's Dominant can quickly close out games. By combining early pressure with late-game threats, this deck aims to maintain a relentless tempo and pressure the opponent into submission.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By combining evasive creatures like Faerie Mastermind with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Shoot the Sheriff, you can control the board and keep up the pressure. Cards like Phantom Interference and Spell Stutter also provide disruption and protection for your key creatures. The inclusion of Malcolm, Alluring Scoundrel adds a versatile threat to the deck, while Tishana's Tidebinder and Enduring Curiosity help maintain card advantage and keep up the tempo.

The main concept of this Dimir Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruption spells. By utilizing cards like Faerie Mastermind and Floodpits Drowner to put pressure on the opponent, while also using cards like Cut Down and Go for the Throat to control the board and remove any threats. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of damage and tempo advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence through aggressive creatures like Cecil, Dark Knight and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, supported by disruption spells like Cut Down and Go for the Throat. The deck also utilizes Faerie Mastermind and Spyglass Siren for added control and card advantage. The mana base includes lands like Floodpits Drowner and Gloomlake Verge to ensure smooth color fixing. Soulstone Sanctuary and Enduring Curiosity help to keep the pressure on the opponent and maintain card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The main focus of this Dimir Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disrupt their strategy with various control elements. By utilizing a combination of powerful creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Floodpits Drowner, along with spells like Go for the Throat and Spyglass Siren, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain it throughout the game. Additionally, cards like Soulstone Sanctuary and Enduring Curiosity provide card advantage and resilience in longer matches. The deck's strategy is to outpace the opponent and secure a swift victory.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures and powerful spells. By utilizing a combination of cheap creatures like Marauding Mako and Voldaren Thrillseeker along with efficient removal spells like Torch the Tower, the deck can apply consistent pressure early in the game. Cards like Profit's Eidetic Memory and Fear of Missing Out provide card advantage to maintain momentum. The inclusion of counter spells like Spell Pierce and powerful finishers like Glacial Dragonhunt ensures that the deck can close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on using control spells like Stock Up, Get Lost, and No More Lies to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up resources with Meticulous Archive and Floodfarm Verge. Beza, the Bounding Spring and Ultima serve as win conditions, backed up by Marang River Regent and Elspeth, Storm Slayer for additional threats. Restless Anchorage and Demolition Field help control the board, while Three Steps Ahead and Dreams of Laguna provide card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent through control and card advantage until it can secure a win with its powerful creatures and spells.

This deck focuses on aggressively playing and utilizing cheap, efficient spells and creatures to quickly overwhelm and defeat the opponent. Cards like Stormchaser's Talent and Vivi Ornitier are used to deal damage quickly, while cards like Stock Up and Opt help to draw into additional resources. The deck also includes some control elements like Thundertrap Trainer and Valley Floodcaller to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and tempo to secure victory in a fast-paced manner.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and disruption spells to quickly overwhelm opponents and control the board. By combining cards with abilities that enhance its creatures' power and toughness, as well as removal spells to deal with threats, the deck aims to maintain a strong board presence and apply constant pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards that can generate card advantage and tempo advantage also helps the deck to stay ahead in resources and outmaneuver opponents.

This deck focuses on using a combination of low-cost spells and creatures to quickly apply pressure on the opponent, ultimately aiming to finish the game as quickly as possible. By utilizing cards that provide card draw and selection like Opt and Sleight of Hand, the deck can maintain a steady flow of threats. With a mix of burn spells like Obliterating Bolt and Torch the Tower, alongside evasive creatures like Vivi Ornitier, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

This Azorius Aggro deck focuses on aggressive play by quickly building a board presence with cheap creatures like Novice Inspector and Spyglass Siren. It also includes cards like Regal Bunnicorn and Mockingbird for extra aggression. The deck utilizes cards like Enduring Curiosity and Restless Anchorage to maintain card advantage and tempo. Floodpits Drowner and Tishana's Tidebinder provide control options. The inclusion of Adarkar Wastes and Seachrome Coast ensures consistent mana base. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and control elements.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to establish early board presence with creatures like Vivi Ornitier and use efficient removal spells such as Torch the Tower to clear the way for damage. The deck also utilizes card draw with Opt and Sleight of Hand to maintain a steady flow of resources. Marang River Regent and Ral, Crackling Wit provide additional threats and ways to close out the game. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows the deck to cast its spells smoothly.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to cast powerful spells like Omniscience and Roiling Dragonstorm. By utilizing cards that can manipulate the top of the deck, such as Scrollshift and Meticulous Archive, the player can set up game-winning combos. The deck also includes control elements like Day of Judgment and Get Lost to manage the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal is to achieve a dominating board presence with powerful creatures like Overlord of the Mistmoors and Marang River Regent while leveraging the advantage gained from casting spells for free with Omniscience.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By utilizing cards like Burst Lightning and Overprotect to control the board, while deploying threats like Screaming Nemesis and Emberheart Challenger to pressure the opponent, the deck aims to establish an early advantage and maintain it throughout the game. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure a smooth curve and consistent access to both red and green mana sources.Overall, the deck is designed to apply relentless pressure and quickly close out games.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent through aggressive plays. By using efficient card draw spells and versatile creatures with abilities, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and deal damage at a fast pace. The inclusion of removal spells and powerful finishers allows the deck to maintain its aggressive strategy while also being able to handle threats from the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the quick and consistent casting of spells to keep up the pressure.
